name: opencode-context-analysis
description: A powerful plugin that provides detailed token usage analysis for your AI sessions, tracking how tokens are distributed across system prompts, user messages, and tool outputs.

installation.summary: Clone the plugin and copy the .opencode folder to your project root for local analysis.
installation.markdown:
## Installation

### For a Single Project

```bash
git clone https://github.com/IgorWarzocha/Opencode-Context-Analysis-Plugin.git
cp -r Opencode-Context-Analysis-Plugin/.opencode ./
```

Restart OpenCode and use `/context` command.

### For All Projects (Global)

```bash
git clone https://github.com/IgorWarzocha/Opencode-Context-Analysis-Plugin.git
cp -r Opencode-Context-Analysis-Plugin/.opencode ~/.config/opencode/
```

The plugin automatically handles tokenizer dependencies on first use.

usage.markdown:
## Usage

### Basic Commands

- `/context` - Standard token usage analysis
- `/context detailed` - More detailed breakdown
- `/context short` - Quick summary
- `/context verbose` - Maximum detail

### Advanced Options

- `/context "extremely detailed"` - Custom verbosity
- `/context sessionID:your-session-id` - Analyze specific session
- `/context limitMessages:5` - Limit analysis depth

### Features

- **Visual Charts**: Bar charts showing token distribution
- **Tool Analysis**: See which tools consume most tokens
- **Multi-Model Support**: Works with OpenAI, Claude, Llama, Mistral, etc.
- **Local Processing**: All analysis happens locally, no data sent externally
